string-array.name: quote_message
string-array.item: Alcohol is the worst enemy. Don\'t let it master you. Never give up!
You have been eager to step on the road to abstinence for a long time. You are on the way to achieve the goal and getting better and better.
Do not wait for your ship to come in - swim out to it.
You are aware that you are getting better through failure. Treasure each day that you stay sober.
You start to understand and love yourself. Your first and last love is self-love.
Let us not look back in anger nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
You are rich or poor according to what you are, not according to what you has. You should be determined to keep yourself sober.
You are facing challenges of being sober. Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them, but do not let them master you.
You are a great believer in luck. You find that the harder you work on maintaining sobriety, the more sobriety you have.
You believe you don\'t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
A good goal is like a strenuous exercise - it makes you stretch.
We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give!

string-array.name: quote_learning
string-array.item: Face the enemy and believe in yourself!
Be decided and hold out hope!
Be determined and take the initiative!
Self-love and be kind to yourself!
Keep calm and cherish every momnet of life!
Be responsible and devote to maintain sober!
Be active to change and brave to face and accept yourself!
Perceive your physical and mental progreses!
keep going forward and understand yourself!
Keep working hard and be with steel determination!
Appreciate other people\'s help and give back to others!

string-array.name: quote_learning_extend
string-array.item: As you drink, the higher your BAC, the more impaired you become by alcohol\'s effects.
These alcohol\'s effects can include: reduced inhibitions, slurred speech, motor impairment, etc.
These alcohol\'s effects can include: Confusion, memory problems, concentration problems, etc.
These alcohol\'s effects can include: Coma, Breathing problems, Death, etc.
Alcohol dependence is a disease that includes four symptoms: craving, loss of control, physical dependence, and tolerance.
Risks of drinking can include: car crashes and other accidents, risky behavior, violent behavior, suicide and homicide.
People who drink too much over a long period of time may experience alcohol\'s longer-term effects, which can include: alcohol dependence, health problems, and increased risk for certain cancers.

People who are alcoholic often spend a great deal of their time drinking, making sure they can get alcohol, and recovering from alcohol\'s effects, often at the expense of other activities and responsibilities.
People who are alcoholic may not fulfill responsibilities at home, work, or school because of their drinking.
People who abuse alcohol may also put themselves in dangerous situations or have legal or social problems due to their drinking.
Cirrhosis is the 12th leading cause of death in the United States.
Among all cirrhosis deaths in 2009, 48.2 percent were alcohol related.

Liver transplantation does not cure alcoholism, as evidenced by the fact that roughly 20% of these patients use alcohol following transplant, with one third exhibiting \'repetitive or heavy drinking\'.
Globally, for persons aged 15-49 years the leading risk factor for death and disability was alcohol use.
More than 10 percent of U.S. children live with a parent with alcohol problems, according to a 2012 study.

Alcohol is the worst enemy. Don\'t let it master you. ___ give up!
